channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024061141
item.description:
Report X-2024061141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Responded to report of leaking container. Found container leaking liquid /sludge material from the corners where the door latches. Tightening the door did not work, liquid then pumped off, and sludge material left over solidified for continued shipment.

item.title: Report X-2024060999
item.description:
Report X-2024060999

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-15
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found with a large wet spot on the ide. Further inspection showed one of two bottles had a loose cap and leaked out some of it contents. No sign of damage to the other bottle. Package was placed in a hazbag lined hazmat tote to await directions in disposition.
